item.description:
PLEASE -- TAKE A FEW MINUTES AND REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW. By signing up you have agreed to our GROUP GUIDELINES.


EVENT ORGANIZER:
Julie Moran Please contact me here with your thoughts and ideas about this trip: jmmoran @ nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882. PLEASE -- no calls except for day-of scheduling issues. You can text me as well. This event is scheduled as a weekend visit to northern Vermont that also includes a hike to Camel's Hump; you can also do this as a shorter trip with Tomoko's Hike/Snowshoe Vermont! Group.


Jay Peak from the east (near Jay Village).



ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS:

Difficulty: About 11 miles, about 2,000 feet total vertical climb. At 1.5 miles per hour average, this hike should not take longer than 7.5 hours.

Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link): This link shows a route from the Elmore State Park camping area; then to the Long Trail trailhead on Route 242 CAR SPOT (ALL HIKERS DRIVE HERE FIRST); and lastly, to the HIKE START at the Long Trail trailhead on Route 105, near Jay, VT. USE THE COMMENTS FIELD TO ARRANGE CARPOOLS.

Hike Start Time: 8:15 a.m.

Estimated Travel Cost for Non-Driver / Carpoolers: $60 divided by the number of riders.


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items. Wear multiple synthetic layers to adjust for colder fall temperatures.


DETAILS / UPDATE (09/29/2010 5 p.m.):
This is a cross-posted trip with Hiking Mates CHALLENGE, the Hike/Snow Shoe Vermont! group, the New England Hiking Meetup and the 4 Seasons Hiking Group.

This is the second time I've visited this area though I only hiked to North Jay at the time -- but I got my super amazing Nautica jacket off a tree branch, the best piece of clothing I've ever "owned"! I'm looking forward to returning to that tree, where I recall the first view of Jay peak's gondola.

After the car spot, this route begins the north end of the Long Trail's exit at Route 105; passes the Shooting Star lean-to and goes over the North Jay-Doll Peak ridge; then goes into a col to the Laura Woodward Lean-to; then up to Jay Peak and the bushwhack round-trip to Big Jay. From there the descent passes Jay Camp to the Route 242 trailhead / car spot.

Jay Peak (3,858' ASL) and Big Jay (3,786' ASL) are both on the "New England Hundred Highest."


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

Camping Information:
LINK: The Elmore State Park, where we'll arrange for camping for attendees Friday and Saturday night. NOTE: IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN CAMPING, RSVP AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AND INDICATE YOUR INTEREST IN CAMPING -- SITES WILL BE LIMITED DURING THE FALL "LEAF-PEEPING" SEASON.

Jay Peak:
LINK: Peakbagger
LINK: SummitPost
LINK: MountainZone
LINK: Bob and Geri's Adventures (trip report / photos)
LINK: "Papa Bear" (trip report / photos)

Big Jay:
LINK: Peakbagger (Mt. Wilson)
LINK: SummitPost
LINK: MountainZone
LINK: Bob and Geri's Adventures (trip report / photos)
LINK: "Papa Bear" (trip report / photos)


Big Jay seen from Jay Peak, taken from a ski slope a short ways from the summit of Jay Peak.



See you there! Julie.


WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: GREEN MOUNTAIN SERIES -- FALL ON THE JAYS: A Thru-Hike Option
